derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'the action of raising high'): from late Latin exaltatio(n-), from Latin exaltare 'raise aloft' (see exalt)

entry.def: Exaltation is an intense feeling of great happiness.

example.ex: The city was swept up in the mood of exaltation.
example.tran: 整座城市处处洋溢着欢欣鼓舞的气氛。

means.word_mean: 1. a state of being carried away by overwhelming emotion;

sentences.sentence: "listening to sweet music in a perfect rapture"- Charles Dickens

means.word_mean: 2. the location of a planet in the zodiac at which it is believed to exert its maximum influence
3. a flock of larks (especially a flock of larks in flight overhead)
4. the elevation of a person (as to the status of a god)
